result.execSummary:
The defendant Carol Ruth Noll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 10/14/22.

miscConds.notes:
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/14/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

- No contact with Marshall's.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carol Ruth Noll

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carol Ruth Noll in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Carol Ruth Noll.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  State finds victim notification has been complied with.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served1  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/14/22.
- No contact with Marshall's.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/14/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Carol Ruth Noll in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Parties have reached a resolution and are requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Carol Ruth Noll in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Flynn has received discovery but not an offer and would like time to review discovery with his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-09-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Marshalls Stores in Milwaukee County or their employees.

Defendant Carol Ruth Noll in court. John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/07/2022@2:30p
